page.title: 10The Port of Workington
page.content: This Port, owned by Cumbria County Council, is a deep water port with {cargo handling}on the West Coast, between the Mersey and the Clyde. It is suitable for vessels up to 10,000 tonnes deadweight. The modern enclosed dock offers excellent facilities with a newly constructed{Ro-Ro berth,}3*7 and 2*10tonne cranes, and 1*28tonne Scotch Derrick. In 1983, a new automatic coal handling plant was opened. There are extensive internal rail links with main line British Rail services. The trade figures for 1984 were as follows: {IMPORTS:}petroleum, bark, timber, flasks, liquid sulphur and perlite, some 214,687 tonnes in total. {EXPORTS:}coal, steel rail track materials, ingot moulds and steel scrap, some 425,100 tonnes in total.
